intro: Echites psidiifolius, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that develop into edible, star-shaped fruits. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic flavor and is often consumed fresh or used in culinary applications. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
